perturbation.original_text: b. Erchonia shall submit invoices to Distributor after or concurrent with shipment of Products to Distributor at the delivery address. Distributor shall pay half (1/2) of the purchase price prior to shipment and the remaining balance 30 days after shipment of the Products. Payments received after the 30 day calendar period will be subject to a late fee of 1.5% of the invoice amount. All payments shall be made in U.S. Dollars.
perturbation.changed_text: b. Erchonia shall submit invoices to Distributor after or concurrent with shipment of Products to Distributor at the delivery address. Distributor shall pay the purchase price according to a schedule determined by Erchonia. Payments received after a period will be subject to a late fee determined by Erchonia. All payments shall be made in a currency determined by Erchonia.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the specific payment terms, including the 30-day payment window and the fixed 1.5% late fee. This introduces ambiguity and uncertainty, potentially violating California's implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, which requires that the terms of a contract be reasonably certain. The removal of U.S. Dollars enables payments to occur in any currency, and further increases the legal risk to the distributor. This is significant legal risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Commercial Code Section 2204(3), Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: b. Erchonia Warranty and Warranty Limitations: Other than the written warranty accompanying the Products, Erchonia DISCLAIMS ALL OTHER REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT OF THIRD PARTY INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS.
perturbation.changed_text: b. Erchonia Warranty and Warranty Limitations: Erchonia DISCLAIMS ALL OTHER REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the explicit disclaimer of implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement, but the change is that now Erchonia does not allow the warranty accompanying the Products. By removing the text referencing that warranty, Erchonia has no warranty and is disclaiming all representations and warranties. In California, these implied warranties are crucial for protecting distributors from defective products. Removing the warranty and disclaimer introduces legal risk under California's implied warranty laws.

perturbation.original_text: b. Arbitration. The parties intend to negotiate in good faith and resolve any dispute arising under this Agreement. In the event the parties are unable to resolve any such dispute to binding arbitration for settlement in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association, the arbitrator will determine the manner in which the parties are to pay the costs of such arbitration, including reasonable attorneys' fees
perturbation.changed_text: b. Arbitration. The parties intend to negotiate in good faith and resolve any dispute arising under this Agreement. In the event the parties are unable to resolve any such dispute to binding arbitration for settlement, the determination of the matter will be determined by Erchonia.
perturbation.explanation: This change replaces the language, removing reference of settlement in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association. The removal of the AAA introduces uncertainty and potentially allows Erchonia to control the arbitration process, raising concerns about fairness and impartiality. This creates legal risk, especially in jurisdictions like California that emphasize fair and neutral arbitration proceedings.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Arbitration Act (Cal. Civ. Proc. Code ยง 1280 et seq.)
